page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: The{farms}(average size 100-150 acres) are all grassland, with grazing rights on common land,which is heather moorl and. All but one are{sheep and{cattle}breeding and rearing and there is one dairy farm. The area is classed as a less favoured hill farming area, and as such, receives higher rates of subsidy. {CATTLE}-Cows are Angus X Friesian, Hereford X Friesian and Friesian. They are mated with Charolais, Limousin and Blonde Aquitaine{bulls.} The{calves}are born in spring and autumn, and are sold for about Â£350 at 8-12 months at{store sales}in October and May at Tow Law,Hexham and St John's Chapel{Auction Marts.} The cows are grazed outside from May to November and housed during the winter. They eat hay, silage and some concentrates.
